change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 237/2018, effective November 15, 2018.

reg:regulation.reg:title: Transfer of Union Board Powers and Duties Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the minister specifies that this regulation applies for purposes of a regional health board or community health council, this regulation applies for all purposes within the region of the regional health board or community health council.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application of provisions of the Health Act to regional health boards

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Sections 31 and 44 (1) of the Health Act respecting a union board apply to a regional health board and a community health council.
Section 41of the Health Act respecting a municipal council applies to a regional health board and a community health council.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Public bodies are no longer to appoint medical health officers
bcl:section.bcl:text: No public body may appoint a medical health officer to serve within the region of a regional health board or community health council.
An asset or liability of a union board may be transferred to a regional health board or a community health council by written agreement with the regional health board or the community health council.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A union board is exempt from its duties under sections 31 and 44 (1) of the Health Act.
A municipal council is exempt from its duties under section 41 of the Health Act.
